Growing up I always heard about Half-Life but I never got to dive in to the series as I was always a console player as a kid. 

Now that I have a gaming PC, 20+ years after this game released, I finally played through it.

Had a really good time. The game still holds up and getting to experience the series that influenced so many games to come was really cool.

I am officially a fan. Now onto the expansions and then Half-Life 2.

Half-Life, I‚Äôm my opinion and I‚Äôm sure in many others opinions half life is one of the most important games ever. Up until the release of half life in 1998 by valve corp and published by seria studios, games were just spawn and shoot; not really any story. Half life added an entire story with a fun multiplayer that you could play for hours. The story has an amazing storyline and very fun puzzles. With new enemies to encounter at ever corner, to zombies taken over by head crabs turned into a human host, to hazardous environment soldiers and the black ops unit! This game is not just amazing but extremely important, 11/10. Extremely recommended, worth its price if not more!!

One of the games from the past that holds up EXTREMELY well today. The gameplay is pretty good, though sometimes can be...don't play on hard mode basically.
Graphics are fine, temper your expectations, it's literally from another century, but the way they are made, set up an atmospheric style that is really effective at some points.


For a cons section, the default fov is pretty garbage, I'd recommend bumping it up by like an extra 20 ("default_fov 90" is the command to change it). Also, at certain points I started getting...nauseous? If you start playing for extended periods and start getting a headache, GET OFF! At least for like an hour or two because that nauseous feeling is pretty bad, I've never had that happen with a game before. Lastly, there are some glitches, geometry being number one, but they're few and far between, just make sure to save often as the autosaves in this game are pretty hit or miss.

All in all, a worthy purchase if you're going in with the right mindset, I personally bought the Valve-whatever-the-fuck-bundle, and I'm getting a pretty good mileage out of it.

It's extremely controversial, but I truly despise this game. The platforming is awful and your character is on ice, the sound design is at first charming and quickly becomes jarring. Especially when you are in the metal tube with the tentacle monster. The encounter design is really good, and I had fun in some parts, but it cannot compensate all the little things that make this game so annoying.  The number of times I got stuck in a wall or an object cannot even be counted with my hands. Sometimes it's just snipers that I couldn't kill and others, it was the level design totally confusing me and the countless time I just didn't know where to F***ing go!

I want to like this game, and I do like most of the fight encounters, but it's not enough, I hate it so much... Sorry

Playing Half Life was perhaps the worst and most grueling gaming experience of my life. 3 hours felt like 30. Every single encounter is, simply put, insufferable. Health drops are scarce, enemies are not and will shred you. The very act of MOVING is appalling and is as if you are on ice at all times. Playing this game can best be described as a chore. Overall game design is terrible and there are numerous points where the game sets you up for failure and I had apparently only just barely made it halfway through. how people enjoy or enjoyed this game is beyond me.
This game really makes you feel like a scientist

Half-Life, un cl√°sico Survival Horror -es de destacar que el termino de "Survival Horror" nace en 1996, con el lanzamiento de el primer Resident Evil, de la desarrolladora oriunda del pa√≠s del Sol Naciente, Capcom- First Person Shooter del 98 desarrollado por Valve, un titulo indispensable si de historia de los videojuegos se habla, siendo un punto referencial entre los FPS del momento y para los videojuegos de hoy d√≠a. Ya que en a√±os anteriores al lanzamiento de Half-Life se estrenaban t√≠tulos que hoy son cl√°sicos entre los FPS, juegos como Doom (1993) por ejemplo, este √∫ltimo siendo un pilar sumamente importante en el genero Shooter y su posterior masificaci√≥n. Resumiendo muy escuetamente la jugabilidad del titulo anteriormente nombrado, esta misma era b√°sicamente aparecer en un mapa en su totalidad cuadrado aunque con tramos laber√≠nticos y limpiar el cuarto antes nombrado de demonios, seg√∫n el poco contexto que se nos da todos los acontecimientos de Doom ocurren en Marte, m√°s espec√≠ficamente en la UAC, una conglomeraci√≥n multi-planetaria.

Con lo que respecta a la historia que se nos cuenta en el primer Half-Life, si bien esta no tiene la complejidad que la saga Metal Gear, tiene su propia manera de ser contada mediante cient√≠ficos de las instalaciones de Black Mesa, que nos dicen por ejemplo, que los militares vendr√°n a salvarnos, para luego ya m√°s avanzado el juego temerlas a estos √∫ltimos. Esto es un muy importante en la revoluci√≥n con respecto a la historia y narrativa en los shooters que supuso Half-Life, ya que sin la necesidad de cinem√°ticas o interrupciones en el gameplay Valve pudo contar una historia completamente fluida todo desde el punto de vista de Gordon Freeman (protagonista del Juego), que por cierto, no habla en todo el juego, esto para que el jugador se sienta identificado con Gordon y que se sienta realmente en su historia.

Con respecto a los enemigos, la IA de estos es para su √©poca es muy buena, por ejemplo, los soldados de H.E.C.U se resguardan hasta detectar al jugador para posteriormente atacar, si est√°n heridos correr√°n a cubrirse, lanzan granadas a cubierto y si el jugador le lanza una correr√°n lejos de la misma. Si bien estos comportamientos de los H.E.C.U pueden parecer b√°sicos, son perfectamente veros√≠mil, es decir, son bastante cre√≠bles si as√≠ se quiere. En cambio la IA de los Xenianos sin contar a las Lapas no es muy destacable, los Vortigaunts y los Alien Controller simplemente se limitan a atacar sin cobertura y suelen ser sumamente f√°ciles de eliminar.

Pasando al dise√±o de los NPC, hablando desde la subjetividad, me parecen aceptables, no perfectos, pero aceptables valga la redundancia, los Xenionos sobre todo en lo personal tienen un muy buen dise√±o y se ven "acorde" a su entorno a pesar de ser cada especie de Xen no originar√≠a de esta.

Pasando con los cient√≠ficos de Black Mesa, estos √∫nicamente tienen 4 dise√±os, lo que le puede jugar una mala pasada a la narrativa, el caso m√°s claro es el del cient√≠fico afrodescendiente que en el primer capitulo nos da la misi√≥n de ir al Lambda Core. Este mismo cient√≠fico en Half-Life 2 se nos presenta como Eli Vance, se presenta como un viejo amigo de Gordon cuando trabajaba en Black Mesa, esto se conoce como "retro-continuidad"
que se traduce como cambiar acontecimientos pasados de una obra para dar paso a nuevos acontecimientos u otras situaciones, en este caso se nos presenta a Eli como un viejo amigo cuando nosotros no ten√≠amos ni idea que Gordon lo conoc√≠a.

Half-Life, si bien tiene muchos aspectos positivos este peca en poseer tiempos de carga, lo que no esta mal en su totalidad, lo malo en esto es que al ser Half-Life un juego tan veros√≠mil con respecto a su narrativa, el parar al jugador para cargar un mapa puede sacarlo al mismo de la experiencia, esto sumado a que en algunas ocasiones, si esta sonando parte del Soundtrack del juego y se llega a un punto de carga, la pieza musical que esta sonando puede cortarse, lo que si bien no es muy grave, genera una desconexi√≥n tan artificial que, valga la redundancia, puede sacarnos de la experiencia.

Puntuaci√≥n: 9.5/10 | Extremadamente recomendable

Gracias por leer hasta el final, si tienes alguna sugerencia para esta rese√±a d√©jala en los comentarios.

Em 1998, a Valve produziu um novo FPS, Half-Life. Com gr√°ficos impressionantes para a √©poca, voc√™ controla o cientista Gordon Freeman, um cientista em um dia normal, indo trabalhar no laborat√≥rio Black Mesa. Durante o teste, acontece um acidente onde os aliens do mundo Zen conseguem invadir a terra, e assim come√ßa a jornada de Half-Life. Historia emocionante, De fato, um jogo incr√≠vel. do you know who ate all the donuts?

I originally just bought this game because it was on sale for a dollar and I felt it was something I should play at least once, expecting it to be a neat little short game that wouldn't hold up compared to modern games. However, I quickly realized that this was a full game that would end up taking me ten hours to complete, and it was fun the whole way through. The combat is fast and exciting, with a ton of different ways to get through an encounter, yet also some sections that encourage you to switch up your playstyle every now and then. I did have to consult a playthrough every now and then because there are some confusing areas where it's not clear what you're supposed to do, but I may just be stupid. It's definitely worth what I paid for, and I don't think anyone would particularly regret buying this game.

10/10, got scared to death by the fast Black Ops freaks

This is an older game, so you got to be ready for lower graphics. All the reviews I read online were true and I would give it a 8/10 for the story arc and would definitely recommend it as long as you look past the graphics. It has a nostalgic feel if you played any older games, like for me, it brought me back to my halo 1 days in a different game that was just as good. One thing, the little aliens jump scared me a little too much, so watch out and may they all die.
